abstract.t: This likely involves a new TCP/IP standard. I'mnot so technical to know if it's feasible or informed toknow if it exists (perhaps in IPv6), or is proposed. Butsimply put, in addition to the numbered range of ports usednow for IP services like ssh, http, etc., in the interestof security, arbitrary named ports could be used e.g.http://foo.bar.net:mooky, or telnet 0 thisone, furtherthese named ports could be encrypted strings.
